content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast myoepithelial carcinoma, T3N2M0

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Left mastectomy and axillary clearance
		12 Feb 2024 Commenced adjuvant TCHP chemotherapy

Histology:	Grade 3 myoepithelial carcinoma
		ER/PR negative, HER2 3+
		8/15 lymph nodes positive

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 4 TCHP

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 of TCHP chemotherapy. She is tolerating treatment relatively well with only grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips. Her main concern is hair loss which is now complete, though she has adapted well to her wig. Performance status remains 0.

On examination there is good healing of the mastectomy site. No evidence of local recurrence. No palpable lymphadenopathy.

Blood results show stable parameters with hemoglobin 110 g/L, neutrophils 2.8, platelets 245. Liver and renal function remain normal.

Happy to proceed with cycle 4 TCHP at full dose today. Will review again in 3 weeks prior to cycle 5.

cancer_timeline.value: Blood results stable - hemoglobin 110 g/L, neutrophils 2.8, platelets 245, normal liver and renal function

patient_facts.value: Grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips
Good healing of mastectomy site, no evidence of local recurrence, no palpable lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Left breast myoepithelial carcinoma post mastectomy, receiving adjuvant TCHP chemotherapy with good tolerance
Grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy
Proceeding with cycle 4 TCHP at full dose
Review in 3 weeks prior to cycle 5
